Personal

I was born and raised in the far northwest suburbs of Chicago, which is also where I met my soon to be wife Alissa while working a summer camp. I’ve lived nearly all of my life in the midwest and haven’t been west of Des Moines or east of Chicago since I was two years old.

I’ve competed in atheletics most of my life and I enjoy lifting weights and running outdoors during my leisure time. I was a varsity cross country and track and field runner as an undergraduate at Augustana College. While I’m not nearly as fast as I used to be, I still enjoy running a race or two each year.

A few of my other hobbies include: Listening to music - my top 3 all-time favorite songs are “Ocean Avenue” by Yellowcard, “Mr. Brightside” by The Killers, and “I’m Ready” by Jack’s Mannequin, doing crossword puzzles, trivia, following the Green Bay Packers and Iowa Hawkeyes, and watching documentaries or shows like Forensic Files.
